util

Class Input

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.Input

  • public final class Input
extends java.lang.Object
    Singleton class to assist with basic keyboard input operations. Only a single Input object will ever be created. The Input class clusters related input operations and will build one Scanner object to use with input. Scanner objects are big and complex; thus, this approach reduces the overhead associated with the repeated creation of Scanner objects.
    Author:
    Rex Woollard

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Input instance
      Keyword static makes this a class oriented variable, rather than object oriented variable; only one instance of an Input object will ever exist, and the instance is tracked by this reference variable.
      static int MAX_ATTEMPTS
      Each input method allows for a number failed attempts before throwing an exception.
      private java.util.Scanner scannerKeyboard
      Object-oriented instance variable, but since only one Input can ever be created, only one Scanner object will ever be created.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private Input()
      A private constructor guarantees that no Input object can be created from outside the Input class; this is essential for the singleton design pattern.
